channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Halliday raises $20 million to build AI agents that operate safely on blockchain
item.description: Halliday secures $20 million to develop secure AI agents for blockchain, solving critical safety challenges for enterprise applications with immutable...

item.title: Locus Array automates induction, storage for ‘zero touch’ fulfillment
item.description: Locus Array combines an autonomous mobile robot with a picking arm to fulfill orders from 10-ft.-high shelving. The post Locus Array automates inducti...

item.title: How to win the high-momentum stock game
item.description: Momentum stocks have historically beaten the stock market by a large margin — until recently.

item.title: Adobe’s new AI agents can make personal websites for your customers
item.description: Adobe's new Brand Concierge feature lets customers create websites that respond to visitors with personalization.

item.title: Nvidia partners with telecom leaders to develop AI-native 6G wireless networks
item.description: Nvidia said 6G wireless networks are coming, with help from artificial intelligence processing.

item.title: Why sportsbooks like FanDuel and DraftKings really need March Madness bettors to lose this year
item.description: March Madness numbers to know include $3.1 billion in wagers and nearly $5 million in earnings for one player.

item.title: Orion Security emerges from stealth using LLMs to track your enterprise’s data flow and stop it from leaking out
item.description: Beyond catching malicious insiders, Orion also distinguishes between human errors and external attackers for specificity.

item.title: Apptronik brings in another $53 million to fuel Apollo production

item.title: Women’s March Madness teams are being paid for the first time — but they’re splitting $200 million less than the men
item.description: Players won’t receive any of the prize money themselves, but their schools’ basketball programs and athletic departments reap the rewards.

item.title: Muse unveils wearable that combines brainwave tracking and brain oxygen measurements
item.description: Muse by Interaxon, a neurotechnology startup, unveiled Muse S Athena, a consumer wearable that can deliver advanced cognitive fitness insights.
